think_procedure.step2: Understand the normal operation of 'effective_io_concurrency', which is to set the number of concurrent I/O operations that can be performed simultaneously.
think_procedure.step3: Research if 'effective_io_concurrency' has any special values that alter its normal operation.
think_procedure.step4: Discover that setting 'effective_io_concurrency' to 0 disables asynchronous I/O, which is a significant deviation from its normal operation.
think_procedure.step5: Conclude that 'effective_io_concurrency' is a special knob due to its special value of 0 that changes its functionality.
